alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Perry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:07AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Perry and Morgan Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1207 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Caldwell to 6 miles east of Hide-A-Way Hills. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Lexington, McConnelsville, Shawnee, Chesterhill, Perry State Forest, Crooksville, Junction City, New Straitsville, Malta, Corning, Stockport, Bristol, Hemlock, Rendville, Burr Oak State Park, Hackney and Eagleport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
